io.dropwizard.metrics.kafka.serialization

Class JSONStringSerializer

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.dropwizard.metrics.kafka.serialization.JSONStringSerializer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    KafkaMetricsSerializer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    JSONByteArraySerializer

    public class JSONStringSerializer
extends Object
implements KafkaMetricsSerializer
    Converts Metrics into UTF8 string encoded ProducerRecords where the key is the metric name and the value is a JSON document comprising: 
    
 {
   ... the metrics properties ...,
   "timestamp": "2015-10-22T11:50:34.762Z"
 }

    The timestamp is given as an ISO 8601 serialized string. The metric properties will vary by the type of metric being recorded. Using Metrics version 3.0.1 some example encodings are: 

    
 // Gauge
 {"value": 3, "timestamp": "2015-10-22T11:50:34.762Z"}

 // Counter
 {"count": 7, "timestamp": "2015-10-22T11:50:34.762Z"}

 // Meter
 {
   "count": 7,
   "m1_rate": 2,
   "m5_rate": 4,
   "m15_rate": 3,
   "mean_rate": 1,
   "units": "events/second",
   "timestamp": "2015-10-22T11:50:34.762Z"
 }

 // Histogram
 {
   "count": 7,
   "max": 2,
   "mean": 4,
   "min": 3,
   "p50": 1,
   ... p75, p95, p98, p99 ...
   "p999": 1,
   "stddev": "0.013",
   "timestamp": "2015-10-22T11:50:34.762Z"
 }

    The exact encoding may change depending on the version of the Metrics library in use. See MetricsModule for exact details.

    Produces one message (ProducerRecord) per metric.

    Note that this is a singleton class: use the INSTANCE member rather than attempting to instantiate a new instance.

    • Method Detail

      • metricRecord

        protected org.apache.kafka.clients.producer.ProducerRecord<?,?> metricRecord(String topic,
                                                                             String key,
                                                                             String value)
        Performs the actual encoding of the JSON data into a ProducerRecord.

        Sub classes can override this method to produce messages in different formats without concerning themselves with the conversion of the metrics into JSON documents. (As JSONByteArraySerializer does.)

        Parameters:
        topic - the topic to which the message will be posted
        key - the key of the message
        value - the JSON formatted metric value
        Returns:
        a Kafka ProducerRecord

      • addMetricMessages

        protected <T extends com.codahale.metrics.Metric> void addMetricMessages(List<org.apache.kafka.clients.producer.ProducerRecord<?,?>> messageList,
                                                                         SortedMap<String,T> metrics,
                                                                         String topic,
                                                                         Date timestamp,
                                                                         com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonGenerator jsonGenerator,
                                                                         StringWriter buffer)
                                                                  throws IOException
        Given a generic collection of metrics of varying types, converts them to JSON including an ISO 8601 formatted timestamp, creates corresponding ProducerRecords for sending to Kafka, and adds them to the given message list.
        Parameters:
        messageList - the list to which the generated Kafka ProducerRecords should be added.
        metrics - the metrics to convert for publication to Kafka
        topic - the Kafka topic to which the metrics should be published
        timestamp - the timestamp when the metrics were generated
        jsonGenerator - the JsonGenerator to use
        buffer - the buffer to use when constructing the JSON message bodies
        Throws:
        IOException - if writing a metric to JSON fails

      • serialize

        public List<org.apache.kafka.clients.producer.ProducerRecord<?,?>> serialize(SortedMap<String,com.codahale.metrics.Gauge> gauges,
                                                                             SortedMap<String,com.codahale.metrics.Counter> counters,
                                                                             SortedMap<String,com.codahale.metrics.Histogram> histograms,
                                                                             SortedMap<String,com.codahale.metrics.Meter> meters,
                                                                             SortedMap<String,com.codahale.metrics.Timer> timers,
                                                                             String topic,
                                                                             Date timestamp,
                                                                             TimeUnit rateUnit,
                                                                             TimeUnit durationUnit)
                                                                      throws RuntimeException
        Description copied from interface: KafkaMetricsSerializer
        Given maps of the metrics to report (one per type: gauges, counters, histograms, meters, and timers) returns a list of corresponding messages that should be posted to Apache Kafka.

        Each message in the returned list should be a ProducerRecord populated with an appropriate topic, partition, key, and value for posting to Kafka. The default topic of the calling KafkaReporter is provided as an argument.

        The serializer is free to return as many or as few messages as it wants: one message per metric, one message containing all the metrics, or anything in between.

        Specified by:
        serialize in interface KafkaMetricsSerializer
        Parameters:
        gauges - a map of the Gauge metrics to publish
        counters - a map of the Counter metrics to publish
        histograms - a map of the Histogram metrics to publish
        meters - a map of the Meter metrics to publish
        timers - a map of the Timer metrics to publish
        topic - the default topic to publish the metrics to
        timestamp - the timestamp when the metrics were generated
        rateUnit - the rate unit used for sampling the metrics
        durationUnit - the duration unit used for sampling the metrics
        Returns:
        a List of ProducerRecords to publish to Kafka
        Throws:
        RuntimeException
